channel.title: Music
channel.description: NPR Music features, streams, live concerts and music news.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Heavy Rotation: 5 Songs Public Radio Can't Stop Playing
item.description: Our panel of public-radio music obsessives has five more favorites to share. Download new music from CHVRCHES, Joey Bada$$, Lady Lamb the Beekeeper and Frightened Rabbit, plus a sick remix of Tame Impala by Australian producer Light Year.
item.content:encoded:
Our panel of public-radio music obsessives has five more favorites to share. Download new music from CHVRCHES, Joey Bada$$, Lady Lamb the Beekeeper and Frightened Rabbit, plus a sick remix of Tame Impala by Australian producer Light Year.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Depeche Mode: The Complete SXSW 2013 Interview
item.description: After 30 years together, Depeche Mode puts out its 13th album this week, the seductive Delta Machine. Jason Bentley of KCRW speaks with the band's core trio of members about making music apart and together and recovering from its darkest days.
item.content:encoded:
After 30 years together, Depeche Mode puts out its 13th album this week, the seductive Delta Machine. Jason Bentley of KCRW speaks with the band's core trio of members about making music apart and together and recovering from its darkest days.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: The xx On World Cafe
item.description: The Mercury Prize-winning London band plays hauntingly spare songs from its second album, Coexist.
item.content:encoded:
The Mercury Prize-winning London band plays hauntingly spare songs from its second album, Coexist.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Beyond 'Dayenu': What's Your Music Of Liberation?
item.description: With Passover beginning, Jews around the world prepared to commemorate this major holiday with food, prayers and songs. We're on the hunt for music that helps spool out stories of enslavement and liberation.
item.content:encoded:
With Passover beginning, Jews around the world prepared to commemorate this major holiday with food, prayers and songs. We're on the hunt for music that helps spool out stories of enslavement and liberation.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Marches Madness: From Trash Can To Flagpole
item.description: With its bright beat and direct quote from The Star Spangled Banner, Edwin Bagley's National Emblem march is an American favorite — that almost made the trash bin.
item.content:encoded:
With its bright beat and direct quote from The Star Spangled Banner, Edwin Bagley's National Emblem march is an American favorite — that almost made the trash bin.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Robert Cray On Mountain Stage
item.description: The soulful guitarist fueled the '80s blues revival. Hear him and his band play songs from Nothin' But Love, their latest album.
item.content:encoded:
The soulful guitarist fueled the '80s blues revival. Hear him and his band play songs from Nothin' But Love, their latest album.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: 'The Music Is You: A Tribute To John Denver'
item.description: The Music Is You showcases some of the late singer's most beloved songs, as performed by a cross-genre, cross-generational and entirely impressive mix of musicians. Lucinda Williams, Dave Matthews, My Morning Jacket, Emmylou Harris, Josh Ritter and others all turn up to pay tribute.
item.content:encoded:
The Music Is You showcases some of the late singer's most beloved songs, as performed by a cross-genre, cross-generational and entirely impressive mix of musicians. Lucinda Williams, Dave Matthews, My Morning Jacket, Emmylou Harris, Josh Ritter and others all turn up to pay tribute.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: Telekinesis, 'Dormarion'
item.description: On his third album as Telekinesis, Michael Benjamin Lerner infuses his compact, concise pop-rock nuggets with warmth and messy emotions that make them feel human.
item.content:encoded:
On his third album as Telekinesis, Michael Benjamin Lerner infuses his compact, concise pop-rock nuggets with warmth and messy emotions that make them feel human.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: Caveman, 'Caveman'
item.description: What Caveman's second album lacks in overt grabbiness, it gains in inviting, atmospheric warmth; this is a band that, only two albums into its career, already understands the art of the slow burn and the subtle build.
item.content:encoded:
What Caveman's second album lacks in overt grabbiness, it gains in inviting, atmospheric warmth; this is a band that, only two albums into its career, already understands the art of the slow burn and the subtle build.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: Bombino, 'Nomad'
item.description: The Black Keys' Dan Auerbach pairs up with monster Tuareg guitarist Bombino for a dream-team album. The result balances tightly coiled melodies with wide-open, Saharan spaciousness.
item.content:encoded:
The Black Keys' Dan Auerbach pairs up with monster Tuareg guitarist Bombino for a dream-team album. The result balances tightly coiled melodies with wide-open, Saharan spaciousness.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Partners In Life, Two Country Singers Finally Meet In The Studio
item.description: Kelly Willis and Bruce Robison both had blossoming solo careers when they wed back in 1996, but they haven't recorded a full album together — until now.
item.content:encoded:
Kelly Willis and Bruce Robison both had blossoming solo careers when they wed back in 1996, but they haven't recorded a full album together — until now.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: The 'Girl Who Got Away': Dido Gets Free
item.description: The award-winning British singer is back with her fourth studio album, Girl Who Got Away. She speaks with NPR's Rachel Martin about the role music has played in her life.
item.content:encoded:
The award-winning British singer is back with her fourth studio album, Girl Who Got Away. She speaks with NPR's Rachel Martin about the role music has played in her life.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Beyond Teen Spirit: Learning From Kurt Cobain's Mistakes
item.description: Author Nicole J. Georges discovered Michael Azerrad's Come as You Are: The Story of Nirvana when she was 13. The book became the heart map for her teenage angst. What book helped you find yourself?
item.content:encoded:
Author Nicole J. Georges discovered Michael Azerrad's Come as You Are: The Story of Nirvana when she was 13. The book became the heart map for her teenage angst. What book helped you find yourself?

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Merritt And Dinnerstein, A Musical Odd Couple, On Bridging Their Worlds
item.description: Singer-songwriter Tift Merritt and classical pianist Simone Dinnerstein say the challenge of their new collaborative album, Night, was creating a language they could both speak. They discuss the project and perform live.
item.content:encoded:
Singer-songwriter Tift Merritt and classical pianist Simone Dinnerstein say the challenge of their new collaborative album, Night, was creating a language they could both speak. They discuss the project and perform live.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: The Milk Carton Kids: At Life's Crossroads, A Duo Looks Both Ways
item.description: Both newly 30, Kenneth Pattengale and Joey Ryan reflect on the past and relish the present on their upcoming release, The Ash & Clay.
item.content:encoded:
Both newly 30, Kenneth Pattengale and Joey Ryan reflect on the past and relish the present on their upcoming release, The Ash & Clay.
